---
title: Connect to LLMs
description: Connect to LLMs
---

If you connect to the MCP clients, that supports HTTP, you can directly use your drupal site url, if you followed [previous instructions](/en/mcp-server/setup-configure/) and setup and configured MCP server module.

All below examples require STDIO transport, so [we need our binary](/en/developers/stdio-binary/), but don't worry - it is dockerized and you will be able to use it without even noticing it.

This is the generally the config object to add MCP server for various LLM clients.

Replace the `DRUPAL_AUTH_USER` and `DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD` with your Drupal's credentials that you want MCP server to act as.

**IMPORTANT:** If you are running your Drupal locally with DDEV, you need to specify a `--network` which is your Docker network (see `docker network ls`) and the url will be just `http://web`. Otherwise, if your Drupal is accessible with URL, remove the `--network` and just use your Drupal site's public URL.

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mcp-server-drupal": {
      "command": "docker",
      "args": [
        "run",
        "-i",
        "--rm",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD",
        "--network=17c76994121c",
        "ghcr.io/omedia/mcp-server-drupal:latest",
        "--drupal-url=http://web"
      ],
      "env": {
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER": "admin",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD": "changeme"
      }
    }
  },
  "globalShortcut": ""
}
```

### Claude Desktop

To connect to [Claude Desktop](https://claude.ai/download), you need to add the server config in the `claude_desktop_config.json` file. The file is located at the following path:

    On MacOS: ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json
    On Windows: %APPDATA%/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json

You can also check and edit it in the Claude Desktop's settings.

Put the configuration object there. Don't remember to replace credentials and `--network` (see above).

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mcp-server-drupal": {
      "command": "docker",
      "args": [
        "run",
        "-i",
        "--rm",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD",
        "--network=17c76994121c",
        "ghcr.io/omedia/mcp-server-drupal:latest",
        "--drupal-url=http://web"
      ],
      "env": {
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER": "admin",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD": "changeme"
      }
    }
  },
  "globalShortcut": ""
}
```

After saving the config file, restart your Claude Desktop and you should be able to see the MCP server in the list of servers and the number of tools (actions) it gets from the your Drupal MCP server. If you see this number, you can use it actually.

<svg version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 1414 334" width="2828" height="668"><!-- svg-source:excalidraw --><metadata></metadata><defs><symbol id="image-f3d44229faeb2081b300215cfc7520867bd6b41a"><image href="data:image/png;base64," preserveAspectRatio="none" width="100%" height="100%"></image></symbol><style class="style-fonts">

### Claude Code

Here like in Claude Desktop case, we need to run our binary as a docker container. Replace `--network` and `DRUPAL_AUTH_USER` and `DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD` with your credentials.

```bash
claude mcp add --scope project mcp-server-drupal docker -e DRUPAL_AUTH_USER=admin -e DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD=changeme -- run -i --rm -e DRUPAL_AUTH_USER -e DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD --network=1bca71ea7302 ghcr.io/omedia/mcp-server-drupal:latest --drupal-url=http://web
```

After this, you can use your Claude code with MCP connected to your drupal site and (if you have necessary MCP plugins) do even those things from your terminal which required UI previously - like creating content types, adding new fields, configuring blocks etc.

### Cursor

For the cursor you add the MCP server exactly with the same config as we used for Claude Desktop. Don't remember to replace credentials and `--network` (see above).

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mcp-server-drupal": {
      "command": "docker",
      "args": [
        "run",
        "-i",
        "--rm",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER",
        "-e",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD",
        "--network=17c76994121c",
        "ghcr.io/omedia/mcp-server-drupal:latest",
        "--drupal-url=http://web"
      ],
      "env": {
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_USER": "admin",
        "DRUPAL_AUTH_PASSWORD": "changeme"
      }
    }
  },
  "globalShortcut": ""
}
```
